script:
{{info.comment}}

{% for part in info.parts %} {{rendertype(part,'mf')}} {% endfor %}

{{rendertype(info.indicator,'indicator')}}
{% if info.ms.target %} {% endif %}
MF {{rendertype(info.mf,'mf')}}
Monoisotoic mass {{info.em|number_format(4)}}
𝛂 end group {{rendertype(info.parts[0],'mf')}}
𝛚 end group {{rendertype(info.parts[info.parts.length-1],'mf')}}
Monomer composition {% for part in info.parts %} {% if not loop.first and not loop.last and part %} {% endif %} {% endfor %}
{{rendertype(part,'mf')}}
Ionization {{rendertype(info.ms.ionization,'mf')}}
Expected m/z {{info.ms.em|number_format(4)}}
Closest m/z {{info.ms.target.mass|number_format(4)}} {% if info.ms.similarity.quantity %} ({{rendertype(info.ms.similarity.quantity,{numeral:'0.00%'})}}) {% endif %}
Δ {{rendertype(info.ms.delta*1000,{numeral:'0.00'})}} mDa ({{rendertype(info.ms.ppm,{numeral:'0.00'})}} ppm)
Charge {{info.ms.charge}}

Polymer mass spectra analyser

Ionizations
Comma separated list of way to charge the molecule. ie (H+)2,(H+),(+),(H+)-5
𝛂 end group
Comma separated list of allowed end groups
𝛚 end group
Comma separated list of allowed end groups
List of monomers
Description MF EM Min Max Color
MF Filters Results can be filtered using many criteria
▶
Charge: Min: - Max:
Range of m/z: Min: - Max:
Unsaturation: Min: - Max:
Integer: - non-integer:
Mass Filters Results can be filtered based on presence of peaks in mass spectrum
▶
Threshold (0 to 1):
Minimal height of peaks compare to base peak (value between 0 and 1). If the value is 0, the mass filter will be completely ignored.
Precision (ppm):
Minimum similarity: Similarity calculation is only done if the minimum similarity is over 0 as well as the minimal threshold height
Width: Define the way peaks are compared
Bottom: - Top:
You can as well provide a function that calculates top / bottom depending m/z. If defined it will superseed the parameters from/to.
Zone: Define the zone used for comparison based on monoisotopic mass
Low: - High:
Comparison method:

ops.insert:
When loading an experimental spectrum that is continuous (in contrast with centroid) the application will automatically perform a peak picking and calculate the function that fits the best the peak width depending the m/z. This information is used to calculate the similarity between theoretical and experimental peaks.

After calculating the various possible peaks in complex mixture, this application will also calculate the error (in mDa and ppm) and a linear regression that allows, in case over 10 isotopic distribution with over 95% similarity were found, to post-calibrate the mass axis.
